Key Match Events: Lars Nootbaar and Paul Goldschmidt hit back-to-back home runs in the first inning, the first time this season the Cardinals have done so.
Pedro Pages hit a two-run homer in the eighth that increased the Cardinals' lead from 6-5 to 8-5.
Jordan Walker added a pair of doubles, and Nootbaar also had a double, giving the Cardinals seven extra-base hits among their 12 hits in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cardinals were trying to sweep a series in Colorado for the first time since 2004.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Leahy relieved with the Cardinals and Rockies tied 8-8 but was greeted by an RBI double on his first pitch and then gave up another double that capped a five-run inning and sent the Rockies to the victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Victor Scott II got the start in center field and singled twice.
The Cardinals were just 1-of-9 with runners in scoring position.
